pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:0.5: 21. The training rule on arms akimbo
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking in inhabited areas with arms akimbo. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.3.1: “‘I will not walk in inhabited areas with arms akimbo,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.4: One should not walk in an inhabited area with arms akimbo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, walks in an inhabited area with one or both arms akimbo, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk21:1.9: The first training rule is finished.
